clinical_study.brief_title: MyoVasc Study on the Development and Progression of Heart Failure
clinical_study.official_title: MyoVasc - An Epidemiological Cohort Study to Investigate the Development and Progression of Heart Failure and the Interaction With Vascular Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The MyoVasc - Study is an observational, prospective cohort study. The study is investigating the development and progression of the heart failure syndrome, phenotypes of the heterogeneous syndrome, and the interactions of phenotypes with the vasculature regarding their impact for the course of heart failure.

detailed_description.textblock:
"MyoVasc" is an observational cohort study investigating the development and progression of heart failure (HF). The primary objective of the study is: i, to advance the understanding of pathomechanisms of the heterogenous syndrome in the full range of clinical presentation, ii, to evaluate current clinical phenotypes of HF, and iii, to identify and describe homogenous subgroups with regard to disease development using a systems-oriented approach. A special focus is put on the investigation of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction in contrast to the more investigated and established phenotype with reduced ejection fraction. Further aspects comprise inter alia the relevance of metabolic dysregulation, inflammation and coagulation for the course of the disease.
The primary endpoint of the study is the combined outcome "worsening of heart failure" defined as transition from asymptomatic to symptomatic heart failure, hospitalization due to heart failure, or cardiac death. Secondary endpoints are the components of the primary endpoint, myocardial infarction, stroke, hospitalization due to cardiovascular disease, venous thromboembolism, atrial fibrillation, and all-cause death. Disease progression is monitored by a large panel of biomarkers for structure and function of cardiac and vascular systems and related organs.
Individuals aged 35- to 84-years with echocardiographic signs of heart failure irrespective of the clinical status are enrolled and a subsample of controls without heart failure. Individuals were recruited from health institutions and a population sample from the registration office. The study sample comprises approx. 3,200 individuals, of which N~2,700 individuals have heart failure and N~500 individuals are controls. Study participants receive a highly standardized 5-hour baseline examination in the study center with examinations of the cardiovascular system (e.g. anthropometrics, 2D- and 3D-echocardiography, carotid sonography, vascular function, ankle-brachial index, body plethysmography, capacity exercise testing, blood pressure measurements (resting, ABPM), ECG (12-lead, holter), computer-assisted personal interview, and venous blood withdrawal for bio banking). Annual follow-up examinations are performed via computer-assisted telephone interviews tracking comprehensively the participantsÂ´ health status, assessing current medication and recording clinical events. Every two years, the participant is invited again to the MyoVasc Study Center for the conduct of sequential follow-up investigations, which are identical to the initial examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Worsening of Heart Failure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome "worsening of heart failure" differs between groups: Population Controls: i.e. composite of cardiac death and incident heart failure (i.e. incident asymptomatic or symptomatic heart failure) Individuals with asymptomatic heart failure: i.e. composite of cardiac death and transition from asymptomatic to symptomatic heart failure Individuals with symptomatic heart failure: i.e. composite of cardiac death and hospitalization due to worsening of heart failure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Hospitalization due to heart failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of transition from asymptomatic to symptomatic heart failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Transition from asymptomatic to symptomatic heart failure

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of incident heart failure (i.e. incident asymptomatic or symptomatic heart failure) in controls
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Incident heart failure (i.e. incident asymptomatic or symptomatic heart failure) in controls

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Follow-up of vital status for 10 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of stroke or transient ischemic attack
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Continuous assessment throughout the follow-up of the study
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years
Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of exercise capacity as assessed via peak oxygen uptake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of peak oxygen uptake via cardiopulmonary exercise testing under consideration of the circulatory (blood pressure, heart rate, electrocardiogram) and respiratory response (ventilatory anaerobic threshold and reserve) by a trained physician

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of systolic cardiac function assessed by ventricular ejection fraction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via 2D/3D transthoracic cardiac echocardiography by a trained physician

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in annual follow-up contacts over a period of 6 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of diastolic cardiac function assessed by mitral inflow signal and tissue doppler of the heart
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via 2D/3D transthoracic cardiac echocardiography by a trained physician

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of cardiac strain assessed by speckle-tracking of the heart
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed via 2D/3D transthoracic cardiac echocardiography by a trained physician

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of renal function as assessed by glomerular filtration rate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Worsening of renal function as assessed by estimated glomerular Filtration rate (eGFR) as humoral biomarker of renal function

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of pulmonary function as assessed by FEV1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Worsening of forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1) via body plethysmography

secondary_outcome.measure: Worsening of vascular function as assessed by FMD/FMC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessment in biannual follow-up contacts in a dedicated study center after 2, 4 and 6 years
secondary_outcome.description: Worsening of flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) and constriction (FMC) of the radial artery

arm_group.description: Individuals with asymptomatic or symptomatic heart failure
Individuals free of heart failure and echocardiographic cardiac dysfunction

study_pop.textblock: Individuals with asymptomatic and symptomatic heart failure and Population Controls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Asymptomatic heart failure or symptomatic heart failure
- Written consent
- Sufficient knowledge of the German language, in order to understand study documents and computer assisted interview without any translation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals who are not able to visit the study center due to psychological or physical impairment
- STEMI within the last 4 months, NSTEMI within the last 3 months
- Acute decompensated heart failure
- Surgery, especially coronary artery bypass grafting within the last 3 months
- Acute disease, especially acute infectious disease, endocarditis, myocarditis or pericarditis
